com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow
Interface Sink<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of item placed in the sink
public interface Sink<T>

A data sink that items are pushed into. Items can be pushed into a sink and when a source has run out of things to put into the sink the sink can be end()'ed. Sinks are typically implemented with some kind of buffer and calling sink may block until the buffer is free to accept the data. Calling end on a sink will not end it immediately. Rather, it will place a special token at the end of the sink which will explode when processed. This way you don't have to worry about ensuring the other side has ready everything in the buffer before you end it and you can safely call end as soon as you have run out of data.

See Also:
Source, Worker

Method Summary
 void end()
           Inserts an 'end' item into a sink.
 void push(T value)
          Inserts the next item into the sink.
 

Method Detail

push

void push(T value)
Inserts the next item into the sink. May block until the sink is ready to accept more data (e.g. a buffer is full)

Parameters:
value - The item to insert into the sink

end

void end()

Inserts an 'end' item into a sink. Once ended a sink is no longer usable. Once the other side reads the end item they will know that there is no more data being sent.

This should not be called by workers, workers should set isEnded to true instead.
